description: From Middle English solven, from Latin solvō.

entries.meaning: (now rare, chiefly law enforcement) A solution; an explanation.
examples: KEVIN: I decided a long time ago that just because I love Raymond, doesn't mean I have to love the people he works with. Good solve, Detective.

verbs.description: solve (third-person singular simple present solves, present participle solving, simple past and past participle solved)

entries.meaning: To find an answer or solution to a problem or question; to work out.
examples: God shall solve the dark decrees of fate.

entries.meaning: to find out the perpetrator, the motive etc (of crime)
examples: to solve a murder   to solve a crime

entries.meaning: (mathematics) To find the values of variables that satisfy a system of equations and/or inequalities.

(mathematics) To algebraically manipulate an equation or inequality into a form that isolates a chosen variable on one side, so that the other side consists of an expression that may be used to generate solutions.
(transitive) To loosen or separate the parts of.
